```{r}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, ggrepel, ggthemes, hrbrthemes, patchwork)
```

```{r}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```

a scatterplot of English vs Maths scores.

```{r}
#| echo: false
top_scores <- exam_data %>%
  filter(MATHS > 95 | ENGLISH > 95)

ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = ENGLISH, y = MATHS)) +
  geom_point(color = "steelblue") +
  geom_text_repel(data = top_scores, aes(label = ID), size = 3, max.overlaps = 1000) +
  labs(
    title = "English vs Maths Scores",
    x = "English",
    y = "Maths"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

English vs Maths Scores

```{r}
#| echo: false
ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = ENGLISH, y = MATHS)) +
  geom_point(color = "darkred") +
  labs(
    title = "English vs Maths Scores",
    x = "English",
    y = "Maths"
  ) +
  theme_economist()
```

histograms of English and Maths scores side-by-side using the `patchwork` package.

```{r}
#| echo: false
p1 <- ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(fill = "skyblue", color = "black", binwidth = 5) +
  labs(title = "English Score Distribution") +
  theme_minimal()

p2 <- ggplot(exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(fill = "salmon", color = "black", binwidth = 5) +
  labs(title = "Maths Score Distribution") +
  theme_minimal()

# Combine with patchwork
p1 + p2
```
